verses.text: Back in the day, in the 2nd year of King Darius, God spoke through Haggai to the squad in Judah.
God’s like, “Yo, people of Judah, why are you chilling in fancy houses while my temple is still a mess?”
He says, “Look around—this is wild. You’re living comfy, but my house is still wrecked.”
God’s asking, “Don’t you think about me when you’re vibing in your own cribs?”
“Come on, fam. Get your act together—time to step up and rebuild my house.”
“You’ve been grinding for yourselves, but see? Nothing’s really sticking. Money, energy—it’s like you’re running on empty.”
God continues, “Check your vibe: planting a lot, but the harvest ain’t hitting like you thought.”
“Come on, build my temple first. Then all your grind will actually pay off.”
“You thought you were set, but your hustle got delayed—because you forgot me.”
God’s like, “That drought in your crops and struggles? That’s on you ignoring me.”
“Even your paycheck and resources aren’t stretching right because my temple isn’t done.”
Then the squad obeyed God’s voice through Haggai, and they got motivated.
Haggai said, “I’m with you! God’s vibe is on you.”
So God sparked action in Zerubbabel, Joshua, and the people of Judah—they started rebuilding.
This happened on the 24th day of the 6th month in the 2nd year of King Darius.
On the 21st day of the 7th month, God spoke again through Haggai to the squad in Judah and Jerusalem.
God’s like, “Yo, the elders are seeing the temple rebuild—don’t get shook by the vibes of the past.”
“Remember the OG temple? Yeah, it looked lit back then, but compare it to now—don’t freak out.”
“Be strong, fam! Zerubbabel, Joshua, and all of you—don’t get weak. God’s got you.”
“Don’t sweat it. I’m still with you, just like when you left Egypt and all the way through the desert.”
“Here’s the tea: I’m about to shake things up—mountains, nations, and kingdoms.”
“Everything I shake will settle, and the treasures of all nations will slide into my temple.”
“All the glory and clout? That’s mine. Everything belongs to me.”
“My temple will be lit—more epic than the first one—and you’ll see it, fam. I’m giving peace, not drama.”
Haggai asked, “If a holy thing touches normal stuff, does it get holy too?”
God replied, “Nah. It stays regular unless it touches me. That’s the vibe.”
“Example: If a pure animal touches something impure, it’s impure too.”
“Touch something impure with impure? Still impure. That’s just how holiness works.”
“So watch your vibe, fam. What you’ve been doing? That’s been impure and delayed.”
“Check your harvest: nothing popped off, crops were small, money wasn’t stretching—yup, that’s on you.”
“Your hustle for yourselves? Yeah, empty. You ignored me, so nothing really stuck.”
“I’m shaking the sky, earth, seas, and even your work. That’s why you’ve been struggling.”
“Look at the day you started rebuilding my temple—remember that day, mark it—it’s a new start for you.”
“Since that day, blessings are rolling in. My Spirit is on you now, and your grind will finally pay off.”
God spoke again on the 24th day of the 9th month to Haggai.
“Zerubbabel, fam, I’m about to shake the world—every empire will notice.”
“I’ll smash kings and power, and you’ll be lifted up like a boss.”
“Zerubbabel, I picked you—like my signet ring. You’re my chosen, and I got you for real.”
